security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure documentation/metadata file with no executable code. It describes workflow orchestration processes but contains no scripts, network calls, or file system operations. References to shell commands (git status, local-validate.sh) are documentation of procedures, not code execution paths.

content.user_title: Orchestrate CI/CD pipelines with chained plugins
content.value_statement: Managing multi-step development workflows requires coordinating multiple plugins and maintaining state awareness. This skill provides structured pipelines that chain validation, code review, commit generation, and PR creation into cohesive workflows with human approval gates.
actual_capabilities: Executes pre-commit validation pipelines with autonomous-ci and code-review
Generates conventional commit messages via smart-commit integration
Creates pull requests through jules-integration delegation
Diagnoses and recovers from CI failures using systematic debugging
Maintains state awareness through CHANGELOG.md and git state analysis
Requires human approval before commits and PR creation
limitations: Does not install or configure required plugins (autonomous-ci, code-review, smart-commit must be pre-installed)
Cannot execute code or modify files directly without invoking other skills
Requires manual approval for critical operations (commits, PR creation)

use_cases.title: Validate code before commit
use_cases.description: Run validation, security review, and generate commit messages automatically before committing changes

use_cases.title: Recover from CI failures
use_cases.description: Diagnose CI failures, identify root causes, and apply fixes using systematic debugging approaches

use_cases.title: Automate PR creation
use_cases.description: Chain validation, review, and PR delegation into a single workflow with quality gates and human approval

prompt_templates.title: Fix CI failure

prompt_templates.title: Full workflow audit
prompt_templates.scenario: Review pending changes and plan execution

best_practices: Always run local-validate.sh before claiming pipeline completion to ensure quality gates pass
Read CHANGELOG.md before starting to understand pending work and avoid duplicate efforts
Require human approval at critical decision points rather than automating commits autonomously
anti_patterns: Skipping validation checks and proceeding directly to commit without running local-validate.sh
Bypassing human approval gates for commits or PR creation
Modifying files directly without following the documented pipeline stages

faq.question: Which Claude tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude and Claude Code. It invokes other plugins like autonomous-ci and code-review which must be installed separately.

faq.question: What are the rate limits or usage quotas?
faq.answer: No specific limits exist. Pipeline execution speed depends on external plugins and CI system response times.

faq.question: How does it integrate with existing plugins?
faq.answer: The skill orchestrates by invoking other skills (autonomous-ci, code-review, smart-commit, jules-integration). Each plugin must be installed and configured.

faq.question: Is my code or data accessed externally?
faq.answer: No. This skill only reads local files (CHANGELOG.md, git state) and coordinates other local skills. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: What if a pipeline step fails?
faq.answer: The skill provides structured error handling. Validation failures stop the pipeline. Review failures report issues and continue. CI recovery uses systematic debugging with retry logic.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual workflows?
faq.answer: This skill automates coordination but keeps humans in the loop for approvals. It ensures consistent execution of validation, review, and documentation steps.
